pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This is an old proof of Johan's that's been mathported; it is sorry-free but any tidying is welcome! And suggestions on where to put these things.

nodes.body: I'm confused how the simp failures are appearing; I added one theorem which isn't even `@[simp]`.
It looks like tc is timing out during linting. So it would be good to compare on those examples whether something was just pushed over the timeout or if it is a bad loop now or something

Oh, I was going to say that this file is not imported there but you're right that everything gets imported during a lint. I'll try have a dig through the trace, if not I'll just swap it back to a `def`

Ok, as it turns out importing `LittleWedderburn` into the file with the manifold failures doesn't work, due to conflicting notation (I think between `Algebra.adjoin` and some C^infty stuff). I just turned it back into a def for now.
Is this PR WIP or ready for review?
Should be good to review - it's a bit hard to tidy+read the proof due to the current `simp` behaviour with `zeta` unfolding every `let` within the proof.

There is still [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6800#discussion_r1329014753) comment that is waiting an answer, but then it is ready to go, thanks! (Maybe add a description of the PR and add this result to some library overview, it is pretty important). Thanks!

bors d+

:v: ericrbg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Yes, I was hoping to have a work-around for the zeta-expanding issue before I wrote the comments, as the goal is hard to read in most places because of it, but I will just try and make some!
@ericrbg what's the status here, its delegated, so are there still changes you want to make before merging?
I was asked to annotate the proof, and I was just waiting for the zeta changes to come in to do that so that the proof is actually legible in the infoview!
Can you please fix the errors?
seems to have been a transient CI issue

:v: ericrbg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Lean, are you telling me that in `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Algebra.LeftInvariantDerivation` there is a finite division ring that you now know it is a field?!
i assume it's simpnf timing out, let's investigate
Can we try making the instance lower priority perhaps? it seems like the sort of thing that should be last resort
Linting seems to have passed locally :/ I'll try that, I think that file is just so slow though

bors r+

I don't think this is actually the solution, I think the correct solution for that file is to investigate why it is so slow in the first place.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7197872405/job/19606010575)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7197872405/job/19606011304)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7197872405/job/19606010272)

LGTM, thanks!!

bors d+

LGTM, thanks!!

bors d+
I guess this could be an instance in Lean 4? maybe it would be good to benchmark the affect of that somehow (if littlewedderburn isn't imported anywhere we won't see an effect elsewhere yet though).
I tried this:) in the case of instance it should probably be fully integral domain -> field, I think
Actually that one is potentially a little more complicated as field contains extra data (inv) that integral domain doesn't, so there is a potential for non-defeq loops.
When you tried it what happened? Why not include it in this pr then?
I just changed it in the code, the instance is of course not yet used so we'll have to wait and see what happens
IsDomain + Finite -> IsField could potentially be an instance though.
This can be added, or the comment removed, or something like that.
I found them :)
Could you sketch in a comment the proof you are doing, both here and in the file-level docstring?
I agree, it would be nice to have a short mathematical explanation here.
All these `letI`'s and `haveI`'s should probably just be lets and haves I think
You have to give it a name (could be an underscore) if you use `let` though.

Lol what, that's so random, still I think that's an issue that should be fixed separately. My understanding is that letI is really doing something quite different that let, and that that may even have a performance impact in some situations, but I'm not 100% sure about that.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [ConjClasses.card_carrier, ← Fintype.card_congr ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← Subring.card_top D] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [eval_sub, eval_pow, eval_X, eval_one, ← key, Int.dvd_add_left this] at contra ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [Set.toFinset_card, ConjClasses.card_carrier, ← card_congr ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← hn, ← Subring.card_top D] ```
Can you add here the results discussed on Zulip? There is also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artin%E2%80%93Zorn_theorem

Are you sure this cannot be an instance? 
```lean
example (D : Type*) [hD : DivisionRing D] [hF : Finite D] : hD = @Field.toDivisionRing D
    (@Finite.divisionRing_to_field D hD hF) := rfl
```
works, so I don't see any problem.
Indeed it can; we're not adding any data here
Do you see a reason why `IsField` is not a class?
No, maybe that's worth refactoring!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Wedderburn's Little Theorem
